sentence.Network_en: Because of the crash, there's a six mile tailback on the motorway from junction four.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于发生撞车事故, 从高速公路第四交叉口开始受阻车辆排起了6英里的长队.

PerfectNetExp.abs: tail-shaft 船尾轴tailback 车龙tailgate 后挡板

list.abs: ...rback sneak」。有一个「shotgun formation」阵式，四分卫会在中锋后7码处「殿卫」(tailback,TB)，这种情况通常是往前抛传，不以跑阵方式冲锋。

entry.def: A tailback is a long line of traffic stretching back along a road, which moves very slowly or not at all, for example because of road works or an accident.

example.ex: The flooding led to six-mile tailbacks between west London and Heathrow Airport.
example.tran: 洪水导致伦敦西部和希斯罗机场间形成了长达6英里的塞车长龙。

means.word_mean: 2. the position of the offensive back on a football team who lines up farthest from the line of scrimmage

auth_sentence.content: If the defensive end is lurking outside, the fullback will seal him off to create a cutback lane for the tailback.
